--- In junit@y..., "shmaytan" <shmaytan@y...> wrote:
> Hi!
> 
> I have a bunch of white-box Junit tests and I would like to check if
I
> have executed every line of code with the tests.  Not just every
> method, but every line of code within the method.
> 
> Does anyone know of a good tool (hopefully free...) that works on
Linux???
> 
> Thanks, 
> -Eytan

I know two commercial tools that offer support for showing/determining
test coverage:
1) JTest from Parasoft (very expensive tool), see
http://www.parasoft.com
2) QStudio for Java from QA Systems (less expensive) see
http://www.qa-systems.com/downloads/qstudioforjava/index.html 

Support for JUnit testing, coverage information and creating your own
codingstandard checks will be available in QStudio for Java by the end
of this year.

Greetings
Arie Roy
